intro: Osmoxylon simplicifolium, commonly known as the simple-leaf osmoxylon, is a rare flowering plant native to the temperate forests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, woody stem and elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers clustered in terminal panicles, which bloom during the late spring to early summer season. Its root system is fibrous and shallow, allowing it to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Due to habitat loss, Osmoxylon simplicifolium is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
